Adoptionist

Adoptionists reject the Holy Trinity, believing that Jesus Christ was adopted as God's son at his ascension, chosen because of his sinless devotion to the will of God. They do not revere the Holy Mary, and were declared a Christian heresy at the end of the 2nd Century.
Apostolic

Sometimes referred to as 'Gregorian', this was one of the early Christian faiths founded in Armenia by the Apostles Bartholomew and Thaddeus. It split from orthodox Christianity in the 6th century as a matter of Christology -- they are miaphysite, believing Christ to be of one incarnate nature, where both divine and human nature are united.\n§Y*§! Learned Apostolics may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Arian

Arianism is a nontrinitarian belief that asserts that Jesus Christ is a Son of God, created by God the Father, distinct from the Father and therefore subordinate to the Father. It denies that Jesus is God the Son. The Ecumenical First Council of Nicaea of 325 AD deemed it to be a heresy.
Haruri

The Haruri are a sect from the period of the Four Rightly-Guided Caliphs, named for their first leader, Habib ibn-Yazid al-Haruri. The Haruri were originally one branch of the Khariji 'Rejectors' movement, so called because they rejected Ali's right to the Caliphate.
Isma'ili

The Isma'ilis believe that, when the 6th Imam, Ja'far al-Sadiq died, his true successor was not Musa al-Kazim as the others believe, but in fact was the already dead Isma'il and his son Muhammad. The line of Isma'il has been in hiding for years, but now has emerged to reclaim the Caliphate.
Mahdite

The Mahdites believe that the messiah, or Mahdi, has already risen, and given his commandments that clarify the Qur'an such that no other interpretation is valid. They are led by their own Caliphate of successors to the Mahdi.
Mandaean

Mandaeism is a gnostic religion with a strongly dualistic worldview. Its adherents revere Adam, Abel, Seth, Enosh, Noah, Shem, Aram and especially John the Baptist, but reject Abraham, Moses and Jesus of Nazareth. It is represented in-game as an early form of Manichaeism, and a potential heresy should it resurface.

Manichaeism is a Gnostic religion founded by the prophet Mani, who was put to death by the Sassanid Shahanshah Bahram I in 277. His 'Religion of Light' incorporated elements of Christianity, Zoroastrianism, Buddhism and Gnosticism. At one point, Manichaeism spread far and wide, and was the biggest competitor with Christianity for replacing classical Paganism until it began to fade in the 6th century. Features:
§Y*§! The Manichaean Archegos exists in the Old Gods and Charlemagne bookmarks, and may be restored later
§Y*§! Manichaeans have their own holy festival, the Bema Feast
§Y*§! Manichaeans may elect to dedicate themselves to a Shekhinah upon adulthood
Maronite

Beginning as a movement founded by the monk Maron in the fourth century, the Maronites are a Christian Church in full communion with the Holy See yet under the leadership of the Maronite Primate.\n§Y*§! Learned Maronites may subscribe to either the Antiochian or Alexandrite schools of theology

The Messalians, or Euchites ('Those who Pray'), are a heretical Christian sect that originated in Mesopotamia, influenced by dualistic faiths like Zoroastrianism. Messalians believe that God can be perceived by the carnal senses, and that this perception is necessary to reach perfection. Each person is born with an inner demon, and only intense prayer can drive it out. They also believe that Lucifer is the elder son of God and a force for good, and that incest is sacred since it was practised by the children of Adam and Eve. They have no formal rites and no strict church hierarchy. Features:
§Y*§! Messalians must pray to expel their personal demons
§Y*§! Once the demons are driven out, they can achieve the status of Perfection
§Y*§! Learned Messalians may subscribe to the Antiochian school of theology
§Y*§! Messalians may choose a patron saint to worship
§Y*§! Messalians can create their own Holy Order, the Army of Lucifer
§Y*§! The Patriarch of Antioch will automatically become the new religion head
Coptic

Copts are miaphysite, stressing that Christ had but a single nature, but of both human and divine character. This stance split them off from the main branch of Christianity after the council of Chalcedon in 451. Though not viewed as outright heretics by Orthodox and Catholic Christians, it is a fine distinction. The nominal head of the Coptic Church is the Pope of Alexandria.\n§Y*§! Copts may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Copts may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology

Monophysitism is an early Christian heresy which states that Christ had but a single nature. This is the opposite of the Nestorian position where Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. The nominal head of the Monophysite Church is the Monophysite Pope of Alexandria.\n§Y*§! Monophysites may opt to become Desert Fathers and Desert Mothers instead of monks and nuns\n§Y*§! Learned Monophysites may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Nabawite

The Nabawites believe that the Qur'an was only the holy book for the Arabs, and that they have their own holy book and prophet, just as legitimate, sent by God for their people, modelled on Islam. They are led by a Malik, similar to the Muslim Caliph.

Nestorianism is an early Christian branch which states that Christ has two separate natures - one divine and one human. This is the opposite of the Monophysite position where Christ has but a single nature. The nominal head of the Nestorian Church is the Patriarch of the East.\n§Y*§! Learned Nestorians may subscribe to the Antiochian school of theology

A true saint can only be created after one's death, but it is possible to embark upon that path while one is still alive. It is not an easy journey, requiring humility and a dedication to religious ideals, but success means that one will enjoy piety and recognition -- and perhaps a greater chance of beatification after one's passing. Failure, however, can mean a loss of piety and worse, and failure will be far more likely the more sinful traits one possesses.
Become a Saint

Paulicianism is Christian Gnostic heresy influenced by Manichaeism, originating in Armenia, and known for its militarist attitude and emphasis on only accepting the New Testament as legitimate. Features:
§Y*§! May declare Holy War or Crusade on anyone of a different religion, even other Christians
§Y*§! May gain the Icon-Breaker trait after sieging a Christian temple
§Y*§! May expend Piety to raise units of zealots during a war
§Y*§! Learned Paulicians may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Qarmati

The Qarmatians are a extreme splinter sect of Isma'ili Islam, and believe that there are seven ages of man, each with a new religion and prophet, and the final age is approaching. They believe that the rest of the Isma'ilis have lost the faith, and that Muhammad son of Isma'il is still in hiding, waiting to return as the Mahdi.
Tondrakian

Tondrakians are an anti-feudal, anti-church sect that originally flourished in Armenia between the 9th and 11th Century. They denied the immortality of the soul, the afterlife, and the rights of the church to rule over its fellow man. They supported property rights for peasants and equality between men and women.\n§Y*§! Learned Tondrakians may subscribe to the Alexandrite school of theology
Waqifite

The Waqifi believe that the Imamate has ended before the main branch of Shi'ism has accepted it. To the Waqifi, the final Imam is the Mahdi who will return at the end of days, and they wait faithfully for him.
Zaydi

The Zaydis are a Shi'a group that believe that the 'Alid Imams are not infallible, but are divinely inspired and have a responsibility to lead rebellion against corrupt authority. Nor is the Imamate hereditary. Any 'Alid who rises up in rebellion can become an Imam.
Zurvanist

Zurvanism is a branch of Zoroastrianism that believes in the existence of Zurvan, a genderless god of of infinite time (and space), for whom there is no distinction between good and evil. Zurvan is the parent of the two opposites representing the good god, Ahura Mazda, and the evil Angra Mainyu, unlike normal Zoroastrianism, where Ahura Mazda is the Supreme Being. Zurvanism is further divided by its three schools of thought: Aesthetic, Fatalistic and Materialistic.

If a ruler's court grows out of his control, the results can be devastating. It's entirely possible for the empire to fly apart at the seams. Even if it doesn't, it will become increasingly difficult for the ruler to exert influence over members of his court -- or keep them within the empire after his death.

Faith Organization

In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- indeed, the hierarchy and tyranny of the Orthodox Church is partly what prompted its creation. Its anarchical nature also makes the faithful difficult to control with the traditional feudal structure. It is possible, however, for a powerful Bogomilist ruler to slowly organize and reform the faith into something permanent and lasting...but it will not be easy, and the common folk are likely to resist any such attempt.

He believed that wealth should be shared, and espoused ideas of egalitarianism that were way ahead of his time. A ruler of proper faith should, by the Mazdaki faith, set aside a large share of its taxes for the people -- and force his vassals to do the same.

Appoint Lollard Primate

A Lollard ruler of high enough rank and esteem could gather the political will to elect a member of the Lollard clergy as the leader of the faith. It would be a huge step forward in legitimizing Lollardy as a true religion of its own, rather than simply an upstart of Catholicism.
Appoint Messalian Patriarch

The Bishopric of Antioch is considered to be the highest title within the Messalian hierarchy, and the bishop who holds it can be effectively annointed as the head of the entire Messalian faith -- provided he or she has the backing of a sufficiently powerful Messalian ruler, of course.
Become Muslim Mystic

While Christians regard Muslim mysticism as sorcery or even worse, those esoteric scholars who attempt to study the Qur'an and penetrate its many mysteries are well-regarded and welcome in almost every court. Many have dedicated their entire lives to such study, even to the detriment of their own health.
Become Muslim Poet
It is considered a noble achievement in Muslim society to pen Islamic poetry. Indeed, the greatest Islamic poets are counted as heroes equal to those of military generals and great scholars.
Become Paulician Patriarch
Only one who possesses sufficient prestige and piety can declare themselves leader of all Paulician faithful, and that one will lead them against the rest of the heathens in this world.
Become Waldensian Primate

Only one who possesses sufficient prestige and piety can declare themselves leader of all Waldensian faithful, and thus create a new church as an offshoot of the Catholics rather than continuing an attempt to reform the old fath -- something which is an almost impossible task.
Begin Formalization of the Bogomilist Faith

The formalization of the Bogomilist faith into a structured organization supported by the state will take a great deal of work. It can be done slowly over time, or more quickly provided you have both the respect and piety. Either way, there are likely to be repercussions from those of the faithful who resist such changes.

Thus it is quite acceptable for a ruler to adopt an orphaned [Root.Religion.GetName] child and raise it as their ownan act of generosity, if you will, towards someone who in any other circumstance would have few chances at a meaningful life.
Consolamentum

The only sacrament of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith, the Consolamentum represented a purification of the faithful from sins gained throughout their life. Once the ritual baptism had occurred, the faithful [Root.Religion.GetName] would be considered 'Perfect' and be expected to live a life of celibacy -- as well as to spread the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith further. Most did not receive Consolamentum until their deathbeds, but the zealous would take the sacrament much earlier.
Claim Imamate

The descendants of Fatimah, daughter of Muhammad, hold a special place amongst those of the Isma'ili faith -- the head of the dynasty is considered the Imamah, and primary claimant to the Imamate. With no clear Imamah currently existing, it falls on the head of the Fatimid dynasty to step forward and assume the responsibility.
Build the Church of St. Bogomil

Annointing a Bogomilist Elder will mean true respect for Bogomilism as an independent religion, no longer treated as a heresy of Orthodox Christianity. It will also stabilize the religion and mean that other benefits, such as claims and divorces, can now be provided by the Elder.
Create the Cathar Patriarch

A truly great ruler, dedicated to the cause of the Cathars and a true Perfectus, might be able to raise up a member of the faithful as a Cathar Patriarch: a leader for the faithful everywhere, and able to direct his or her religion to spread throughout the known world.

Doing so means giving up on any hope of supplanting them as the 'official' faith, but is that what we really want?

The coming of age ceremony for all Druze adults, in it the Druze signs the Charter known as the Mithaq Walley El-Zaman -- the 'Pact of Time Custodian'. The Charter embodies all human souls after death, allowing for their reincarnation in the next life.
Renounce Antipope
I can renounce the Anti-Papacy of [Root.RelHead.GetTitledFirstName] in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], putting an end to it and honoring the true [Root.Religion.GetName] Pope.

Formalize the Bogomilist Faith

Enough work has been done to organize the Bogomilist faith for it to now be considered to have a structure of its own. Note that this will mean that feudal lords will no longer be able to hold temples, and that temple holders will be considered Bogomilist bishops as elsewhere in Christendom.
Search for Omens
Study the Holy Qur'an in search of hidden truths about the future. Beware, for the omens could be good or bad, and the resulting effect on your mind could be devastating.

A scholar should spend their life poring over the Qur'an, unlocking its secrets and advancing their understanding of the universe -- even if doing so represents possible hazards such as blindness, insanity, or worse. Renounce Vows
As a Lollard, you are beholden to neither vows of chastity nor vows of religious service -- you may freely renounce both and rejoin the layity.

Translate the Bible

One of the ways the Catholic Church maintains its dominance over the common man is by ensuring that almost nobody can read the Bible. Perhaps the time has come to take the scripture out of the hands of the few and put it into the hands of the masses by ordering a translation of the Bible into the vernacular. It would be an incredibly expensive proposition, and take years to complete, but it would be a terrible blow to Catholic authority.
Choose a Shekhinah
A shekinah is the settling of the Divine Presence of God, representing a facet of Manichaen worship which a member of the faith chooses to focus upon.
Create Manichaen Archegos

The Manichaen faith has been without a true leader for a long time. Now, with the fortunes of the faith having been restored due to your benevolent rule, it is time for a new Archegos to be raised up to lead the faithful into this brave new age.
Patronize Art
Religious artwork is important to the Manichaean faith. Mani himself was known as 'the Artist', and Manichaean rulers would donate their wealth to support the creation of new artistic works.
Create Mazdaki Priesthood

While Mazdak railed against the oppression of the Zoroastrian priesthood, now that his teachings have spread across all of Persia perhaps the time has come to institue an organized priesthood of our own -- one that espouses the egalitarian principles upon which the Mazdaki faith is founded.
Choose Mazdaki Power

The Mazdaki teach there are four Powers that bring Light into the World: Discernment, Understanding, Preservation, and Joy. Any adult member of the faith may embrace one of these Powers. in an attempt to achieve eventual perfection.
Abandon Prayers

The process of driving out one's demons is an exhausting process, perhaps even dangerous. While it would mean failure in the eyes of the Holy Spirit, perhaps it is best to put aside the prayers for a time and restore your strength before attempting them again.
Achieve Perfection

To one of the Messalian faith, achieving perfection -- meaning one is free of the demons who bring with them mortal sin -- is the holiest state to which one can aspire. It means being one with God, and will make the Messalian a teacher of their fellow faithful. It also means that one is free of any obligations to mortal concepts of morality and constraint, as the idea of perfection is literal. If you are one with God, how can you possibly sin? To achieve perfection requires a long period of prayer and fasting, and even then may not result in success unless the Messalian is sufficiently pious and determined.
Castrate Yourself

Follow in the path of the Saint Sabas Apokopos, one of the founders of the Messalian sect, and castrate yourself. In the eyes of the Messalian faith, it is one of the most holy acts a follower is capable of -- though naturally it can only be done once.
Choose Patron Saint

The Messalians believe that there are four important patron saints that watch over them: Saint Nestor, Saint Adelphius, Saint Addai, and -- perhaps most shocking to other Christians -- Lucifer the Lightbringer. It is important that a Messalian choose one of these patron saints to watch over them, and it will be the patron to whom they direct their daily prayers.
Expel Daemons

The Messalians believe that sins are literal demons that exist within the body, and that the only way to rid oneself of sin is to endure ritual fasting and rigorous prayer until the demons are forced out. This is the only way that one can achieve perfection and unity with God, after which point all of one's obligations to morality and piety are considered irrelevant.
Join the Cult of Lucifer

A secret society among the Messalians that honors the Lightbringer as an agent of change. They seek to expose the secrets of Heaven and Hell, secrets they will keep for themselves. To most, however, it is a cult of machinations, where important secrets are exchanged amongst members for their own betterment.
Become Desert [Root.GetFatherMother]

Abdicate any titles you have and wander the desert as a religious ascetic -- becoming a Desert [Root.GetFatherMother] is a respected position amongst Coptics, and a tradition that has been ongoing since Saint Mark introduced Christianity to Egypt after the ascension of Christ.
Embrace Alexandrine School

Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- the Alexandrine School emphasizes the allergorical interpretation of scriptures, and tends to a more pragmatic approach towards the advancement of science and thought...even if that can lead to conflict with the zealous.
Embrace Antiochian School

Those of advanced learning in eastern churches tend to lean towards one of two schools of theology -- The Antiochan School leans toward a more literal interpretation of scriptures, and focuses more on tradition and the advancement of culture...even if that can lead to conflict with those of a more cynical or progressive view.
Observe Bema Feast

One of the most important religious observances of Manichaeism, the bema feast takes place annually at the vernal equinox. It is meant to celebrate the passion of Mani, and this year you have decided it shall be a feast to remember! Note that, if you enact the decision outside of the yearly timeframe in which the feast occurs, it won't actually begin until the equinox.

Restore Order to the Court
Perhaps it's not possible to salvage the authority of your throne. It might require a bloody purge of your court, and that will require you to be strong...very strong, indeed.
Vassalize Archegos
It is only fitting that the Manichaean Archegos be a part of our realm. Perhaps enticing him with the offer of a temple at a holy site would help?
Vassalize Paulician Patriarch

As the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], you are perhaps the most prominent Paulician ruler in the world. The Paulician Patriarch would undoubtedly gladly serve under you.
Vassalize Head of Religion

The leader of the [Root.Religion.GetName] acts as a veritable exile -- without a temple to call their own, a demesne from which to call out to the faithful, and without real legitimacy in the eyes of the world. We could offer that by granting a place within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], something that would be of benefit to us all.
Give to the Poor
Every faithful Waldensian ruler is expected to donate wealth to the poor people of their domain.
Choose Waldensian Path
The Waldensians offer three different paths for their faithful to follow, each with their individual benefits and drawbacks.
Build Hospital

To better care for the poor, your councillors have advised building a hospital in [Root.Capital.GetName] to give proper medical care to the city. While it would be expensive to build and maintain, it would benefit the people enormously.
Celebrate Tawûsgeran

Tawûsgeran, also known as 'Circulation of the Peacock', is an important Yazidi festival where Qewals and other religious dignitaries visit Yazidi villages, bringing the senjaq, sacred images of a peacock made from brass symbolising Tawûsê Melek. These are venerated, taxes are collected from the pious, sermons are preached and holy water distributed.
Yazidi Pilgrimage
Go on a pilgrimage that is of vital importance to the Yazidi faithful: a voyage to visit the Tomb of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir, and attend the Feast of the Assembly.

The Manichaeans believed there were five 'Shekhinah', which are the elements where the Divine dwells. Each Manichaean can choose an element upon which to focus, and once chosen that focus cannot be changed.

After the Manichean Archegos was murdered by the Caliph in Baghdad, many thought that was the end of the religion as an organized church. But like a phoenix rising from its ashes, [new_manichean_leader.GetTitledName] has been proclaimed the new Archegos by [Root.GetTitledName], with the Manichean faith having enough power now to make him no mere charlatan.
A glorious day!
And so the heresy grows more powerful...
The Army of Light

The growing power of the Manichaeans can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army, to smite heathens and infidels and to protect the righteous. They call themselves the Army of Light, and their holy mission is to fight for the cause of good -- in the eyes of the Manichaeans -- and drive darkness out of the world.
A glorious day!

'It is horrible that you can not walk down a street in Baghdad without tripping over half a dozen Manicheans. Why should we let these infidels continue to live while they tempt others away from the true faith?' They are asking that something be done, lest this become an even greater problem in the years to come.
We shall crush the Archegos and his followers
No, I will not attack the innocent

After complaints by [Root.Religion.GetName] worshippers, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has begun a slaughter of all Manichaeans in the region -- beginning with [manichean_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and so ravaging the population that the scholar Ibn al-Nadim reports only finding five remaining in the entire city after the pogrom was finished. The Manicheaean position of Archegos now lies empty, and looks to remain so.
An outrage!

The Singing of Hymns

The Bema Feast starts with the singing of various hymns that celebrate the return of spring, the life and death of the Prophet Mani, and the battles the Forces of Light have won over the Armies of Darkness. All those gathered raise their voices to the gods, a chorus of faith and beauty that touches the soul.
This is my favorite part
The Feast of the Elect

Only the Elect -- those who are devoted to the Manichaean faith -- are invited to take part in a ritual meal, which both symbolizes the life of Mani and the theology of the Manicheans. To take part is a great honor.
Honor and Glory!
The Presentation of the Arzhang

The Arzhang, or Picture Book, is a work painted by Mani himself, which depicts the Manichean theology in simple terms, so that even the uneducated can read and understand the faith. The book rests on the bema until the feast is over, after which a priest recites sermons from it and absolves the sins of those attending.
Praise be to [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName]!
The Persian Uprising

It is said that the Abbasids would never have been able to seize the caliphate without the aid of the great Persian general, Abu Muslim, who in the end was rewarded for his service with death -- executed on the order of Caliph Al-Mansur. Resentment for this perceived betrayal has long simmered as resentment among the Persian people, resentment which has now broken out in open rebellion. A peasant leader by the name of Babak, aided by his capable wife Banu, an effective general and archer in her own right, has risen up to free his nation from the unjust rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]...and has already attracted a massive following, enough to present a real threat to the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
This is an outrage!
It's about time!
The Mazdaki Priesthood

Although the Prophet Mazdak always railed against the corruption of the Zoroastrian Priesthood, and his followers have never had an official structure to speak of, now that the faith has risen to such prominence under [Root.GetTitledName] it seems the time has come to give it to them. With [new_mazdaki_leader.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] chosen as the new [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] of the [new_mazdaki_leader.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName], the Mazdaki faith has entered a new era, with a priesthood rivalling that of the Zoroastrians from which they once stemmed...and have, perhaps, now exceeded.
A glorious day!

I choose the Power of Preservation
I choose the Power of Joy

You have begun preparations for the Tawûsgeran festival, also known as the 'Circulation of the Peacock'. You send out messengers with invitations to your Yazidi vassals, expecting all to come and honor Melek Taus, greatest among the seven angels.
I've been looking forward to this

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],

The time has come once again for us all to celebrate the Tawûsgeran, a time to honor Melek Taus - He who is most holy amongst the seven angels. The festival will take place in [From.Capital.GetName], and you are hereby formally invited to attend.
Sincerely,
[From.GetTitledName]

The Tawûsgeran festival is well under way when you finally arrive in [FromFrom.Capital.GetName]. Priests walk throughout the crowds, giving out vials of holy water to the faithful. You can hear the holy rites to the Seven being chanted at shrines everywhere you walk, though the name of Melek Taus is most prominent amongst them.
An excellent time, to be sure

Peasants are streaming into [Root.Capital.GetName] from all over [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] for the beginning of the Tawûsgeran festival, and already your vassals are arriving. The chanting of rites to Melek Taus can be heard from the many shrines at your window, and soon the true celebrations will begin.
The Circulation of the Peacock

The Circulation of the Peacock is about to start! In accordance with tradition, priests and pious men carry the senjaq, statues of the Seven Archangels, in circles around the city as they distribute blessings. To carry one of the statues is an honor reserved for only those of great wisdom and piety, as well as an event requiring considerable strength and willpower.
I wish to carry one of the statues!
I am content to watch the proceedings

As you carry the senjaq around, you discover that it is rather heavier than you expected. The unaccustomed weight causes you to stumble, and the idol slips out of your hands and crashes down to the ground and is damaged. Everyone stares in horror as you quickly pick it back up.
Only a few people saw that...right?

As you carry the heavy senjaq around, the weight and the heat begin to take their toll upon you. As if in a dream, you begin to hear the voices of the Seven Archangels talking, telling you secrets and mysteries...
They have visited me! I am blessed!
With each step of the Circulation, more and more of the truth of your faith is reveled to you. Of course this is the proper path. How could any man doubt such a truth?
For the glory of Menek Taus!

Perhaps it is the power of faith that fills you, but what once seemed so heavy at the beginning now feels as light as feather. Why, you could carry this senjaq around all day if the priests would let you!
Strength comes from faith
Veneration of the Senjaq

After the senjaq have been paraded around the city, the populace of the city comes forward to present their sacrifices and tributes. You visit each senjaq in turn, praying for the wisdom of the Seven Archangels, venerating them with holy incense.
For Wisdom and Honor
Gifts From the Pious

The final stage of the Tawûsgeran festival is the collection of alms from the pious. Every man and woman is expected to give, a contribution to the greater faith and in support of those in need. While most give only a few coins, those who are able are expected to give much more.
I am a pious [Root.GetManWoman]
I will give what I must, no more
Ignore this nonsense

The final ceremony is a grand sermon of thanksgiving to God and his servants. It was a rousing sermon as always, and the crowd begins the feast with great abandon. Another glorious celebration of the Seven Archangels has been completed!
Praise the Seven!
The Tawûsgeran is over for now, and already the many decorations are being taken down. Melek Taus has been properly honored, and the realm is looking forward to a bright future under His wisdom.
Until next time!
Sadly, the death of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] means the Circulation of the Peacock must be canceled.
Such is how it is
A Koasasa is Discovered

The concept of metempsychosis, or rebirth, is central to the Yazidi faith. Indeed, they believe it is possible for the Seven Archangels to be reborn among the faithful as 'koasasa'. Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Peacock Angel himself, Melek Taus. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.

Today it has been declared that [Root.GetTitledName] is none other than the koasasa of the Burning Angel of the Trumpet, Melek Israfel. Yazidi throughout the land celebrate this discovery, and everywhere the young man travels he is given offerings by those overjoyed by the angel's return to the mortal world.
I will do my best to live up to this honor
A glorious day for us all

The pilgrimage to Lalish, a site just outside of the bustling city of Mosul, is one of the most important journeys a Yazidi can undertake. There one attends the Feast of the Assembly, and returns filled with the spirit and strength of the Seven Archangels...or so the story goes.

The day has come. Your belongings are packed, arrangements have been made for matters in [Root.Capital.GetName] to be attended to while you are away, and your departure has been kept quiet to prevent the unsavory from taking advantage of your solitary journey. Now you must begin your journey to Lalish.
Arrival at Lalish

You arrive in the bustling city of holy Mosul, and it is not long before you make your way to Lalish, a mountain valley village not far to the north. This sleepy place is where the Yazidi faith truly began, and as the Feast of the Assembly unfolds, prayers offered to the Seven Archangels up in the heavens, you marvel at the conical roofs of Sheikh Adi ibn Musafir's tomb. The rest of your stay will be spent in Mosul, but you cannot help but feel overcome at having taken a path so many have walked before you.
Now, what to do next?
The Yazidi Faith

There are many who claim the Yazidi to be devil-worshippers, due to their veneration of the Peacock Angel they call Melek Taus or Shaytan. This has led the Yazidi to be considered Muslim heretics for countless generations, even though their religion incorporates syncretic elements of not only the Muslim faith but also Gnosticism and Zoroastrianism. Now, with [Root.GetTitledName] having risen to such power, [Root.GetSheHe] has declared the Yazidi to be their own faith and no heresy -- and [Root.GetSheHe] has the prestige to be listened to. In the end, it may change nothing save to the Yazidi themselves, but even so it is a sign as to just how far they have come since the ancient days of worshipping at hidden temples in the Kurdish foothills.
Praise to Melek Taus!
They are still devil-worshippers
A New Reign

You are now the Caliph and, according to the tradition set by the 'Abbasids, may take a regnal name by which you shall henceforth be known, a name representing the virtues you seek to engender during your rule. Alternatively, you may break with tradition and keep your own name.
I shall keep my name
I will choose a new name
After a series of discussions with the wise men of your court, a number of options have been put forward for your consideration...
Actually, I DO prefer my original name...
I will be Al-Mustansir, He Who Asks For Help Against The Oppressor
I will be Al-Mustamsik, He Who Is Calm of Mind
I will be Al-Hakim, The Wise
I will be Al-Musta'sim, He Who Holds Fast In God
I will be Al-Zahir, The Helper Of God
I will be Al-Nasir, The Victor For The Religion Of God
I will be Al-Mustadi, He Who Seeks The Light In God
I will be Al-Mustanjid, He Who Asks For Help From God
I will be Al-Muqtafi, He Who Follows God
I will be Al-Rashid, The Rightly-Guided
I will be Al-Mustarshid, He Who Seeks Direction From God
I will be Al-Mustazhir, He Who Memorizes God
I will be Al-Muqtadi, He Who Follows God
I will be Al-Qa'im, He Who Carries Out The Command Of God
I will be Al-Qadir, The Power Of God
I will be Al-Ta'i, Obedient To God
I will be Al-Muti, Obedient To God
I will be Al-Mustakfi, He Who Wishes To Be Content With God Alone
I will be Al-Muttaqi, He Who Fears God
I will be Al-Radi, Satisfied In God Alone
I will be Al-Qahir, Victorious In God
I will be Al-Muqtadir, Mighty In God
I will be al-Muktafi, Content In God Alone
I will be al-Mu'tadid, He Who Seeks Support In God
I will be Al-Mu'tamid, He Who Leans On God
I will be Al-Muhtadi, He Who Is Guided By God

The [FromFrom.GetFullName] can only properly fall to one who is a close relative of [FromFromFrom.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], though perhaps a sayyid of sufficient piety could claim the title has their own. There are some who question whether you are such a man.
I am indeed
I do not need the title
Anarchy at [Root.Capital.GetName]

Dire events are underway in [Root.Capital.GetName], capital to the mighty [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]: [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], considered by many to be a weak caliph, has been turned into a veritable prisoner within his own palace. His advisors have taken control of the court, and already cracks have begun to appear in its authority over the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle]'s vassals. Whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will be able to regain control or whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] will crumble into anarchy is currently unknown.
Oh no!
This travesty is an affront to Allah
It couldn't happen to a nicer caliph
While [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has taken command of the Sunni caliphate, the court remains firmly in control. You will have to be strong if you are to overcome their rule and restore order.
They will not get away with this
Order Restored in [Root.Capital.GetName]

It has taken a bloody coup, with [imprisoned_regent.GetTitledName] being overthrown and imprisoned, but [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has restored order in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. The Sunni caliphate once again has authority respected by its vassals. It remains to be seen whether [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will exact more vengeance upon those of his court who kept him hostage, and whether he will be able to bring the lands he lost back under his fold.
Ha! Finally!
This is a good thing, I think

The court of [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] runs rampant with anarchy and corruption. Perhaps it is time for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] to declare its independence before the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] crumbles completely and takes you with it?
Yes, let us make our own way
No, I am loyal to the caliph!

Alas, the anarchy rampant within the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] has claimed another victim: from your quarters in the palace, you hear that [From.GetTitledName] has declared [From.GetHerHis] independence from the caliphate in pure disgust. Naturally your court is at odds regarding what to do about it.

After the unjust murder of his son by local authorities, a follower of the Kharijite sect of Islam by the name of Musawir ibn 'Abd al-Hamid al-Shari has launched an insurrection in the province of Mosul, aiming to toppling the rule of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]. This presents a serious threat to the caliph, and further evidence of the reign of anarchy in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName].
Muslim heretics in the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName]? Good news!
Another sad blow to the caliphate

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal],
I write you now because I can endure your sins no further. You are a [GetFromFromRootInsult] [Root.GetManWoman], and an apostate in the eyes of Allah. I hereby declare you Kafir!

[FromFrom.GetTitledName]
Oh no!

My liege,
Though it pains me to say it, I can no longer watch your descent into sin. You are a [GetFromFromRootInsult] [Root.GetManWoman], and an apostate in the eyes of Allah. I hereby declare you Kafir!

[FromFrom.GetTitledName]

[Root.GetTitledName] is brought up from the dungeon and escorted to the plaza in [From.Capital.GetName], in front of the cheering crowds and [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] looking on. There, as the sword is raised above [Root.GetHerHis] neck, [Root.GetSheHe] looks at [Root.GetHerHis] [GetFromRelation] with pleading eyes. 'Don't do this, [From.GetFirstName]! There has to be some other way...' Alas, there was not.
You are family, but this is how it must be

[Root.GetTitledName], [GetHusbandWife] of [From.GetTitledName], is dragged into the central square of [From.Capital.GetName], where a huge bonfire roars. In a last, desperate effort to save [Root.GetHerselfHimself], [Root.GetSheHe] calls out to [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]. 'I have always loved you, [Root.GetFirstName], and I always shall!' But it is not enough.
Forgive me then, my love, but this is how it must be

[Root.GetTitledName] is brought up from the dungeons and placed at the block in front of a cheering crowd in [Root.Capital.GetName]'s central square. As they raise the sword above [Root.GetHerHis] neck, [Root.GetSheHe] cries out to the watching [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]: 'Don't do this, [From.GetFirstName]! We are family, and of the same blood!' But the sword descends even so.
It is not enough to save you

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] spits at the ragged creature curled into a ball before [From.GetHerHim]. 'King of Kings,' [From.GetSheHe] mocks, with a sharp kick to the kidneys, 'Bringer of Benefit. There is only one Bringer of Benefit, and that is Allah, whose truth and love you have rejected for idolatry.' [From.GetSheHeCap] raises a great scimitar, shining steel reflecting the screaming crowd, and beheads [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal].
I hope Allah has a special jinn waiting for your soul

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged, stumbling and bloody, before a screaming crowd in [From.Capital.GetName]. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] regards [Root.GetHerHim] and laughs. 'This broken old [Root.GetManWoman], covered in [Root.GetHerHis] own filth, dressed in ragged, once-fine robes, is the [Root.GetManWoman] who commanded a hundred legions of infidels to invade Dar al-Islam? You are so pathetic, it is not even worth the torture. Just cut off [Root.GetHerHis] head.' The attendants rush to do just that.
Pray your carpenter comes to save you

[Root.GetTitledName] flinches, but does not scream, as the nails are pounded through [Root.GetHerHis] hands. The crown in [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square cheers wildly, while [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] looks on. 'You are brave,' [From.GetSheHe] calls out, 'I will give you that. But you should thank me! I am giving you the chance to die like your false savior!'
I wonder if [Root.GetSheHe] sees [Root.GetHerHis] house from there

The blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to him: 'Your sins are great, for there can be no peace when the Commander of the Faithful is not faithful to Allah. Pray for forgiveness now, and maybe Allah will forgive you when you meet Him.'
And I shall send you to Him

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You have kept your faith, that is true. But it is now obsolete. Convert to Islam, or die.' The [Root.GetManWoman] makes no response, save to spit in the ground before the [From.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], sealing [Root.GetHerHis] fate.
So be it

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a roaring bonfire and a wildly screaming crowd. [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'All that work to restore your false religion, yet in the end it is undone once more. Your people worship fire, yes?' [From.GetSheHeCap] grins wickedly at the bonfire, radiating intense heat. 'Let us see how much it likes you.'
Not that much, as it turns out

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s jailors have not been kind to this so-called '[Root.GetKingQueen] of the Jews'. Body battered, face broken and bruised, yet [Root.GetSheHe] still stands tall against the jeering crowd. [Root.GetSheHeCap] breathes a prayer as [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] raises [From.GetHerHis] blade.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] take your soul!

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'All your worldly power, all those armies at your command. They are not but dust in the face of Allah.' The command is given, and [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] dies.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not

The crowd in [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square screams wildly as the execution of [Root.GetTitledName] is carried out. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] looks at the corpse of the [Root.GetManWoman], hanging broken and crucified upon the cross. 'I must give [Root.GetHerHim] credit,' [From.GetSheHe] says. '[Root.GetSheHeCap] did not cry out, not even in the end.'
A pity such a brave [Root.GetManWoman] followed a false religion

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You pagans may have the trappings of a religion, but you are no better than monkeys, imitating your betters. There is but one true faith, and that is written in the Qur'an. Pray to your false idols, but they will not save you.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Goodbye, idolater

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'Give me your trust said the King on his throne,' [From.GetSheHe] quotes, 'but there is no King one should trust but Allah. You have turned your back on the Highest, and now He has turned his back on you.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Let the true King show mercy upon you
column3: Let the true King show mercy upon you

column2: The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [Root.GetSheHeCap] is thrown before [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], who spits on [Root.GetHerHim] in disgust. 'You pigs invade our lands, massacre our people and defile our holy lands with your false god. I tell you this - your death, no matter how agonizing, is far better than you deserve.'
And I will make it quite agonizing indeed

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You have the blood of the Prophet in you, yet you turn against Him. Death is nothing compared to the tortures that await you in the afterlife. But out of respect for the Prophet, I will not shed your blood.' [From.GetSheHeCap] points to the nearby cistern of water, where [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is to be drowned...
It was done respectfully, I think

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You are a wise and noble [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle], and I am sorry it has come to this.' Then [From.GetSheHe] smiles. 'Or, rather, I am sorry I will not receive a ransom for you.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Faith is more important than gold

[Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You have betrayed your God and his Commandments. For the sin of apostasy, I hereby sentence you to death!' The crowd cheers as [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] raises [From.GetHerHis] sword high above the Kafir's head.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim]: 'You are a mighty fighter, [Root.GetManWoman] of the pale North, but there is no strength greater than that of Allah.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Let judgement be done!

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim] with a wry grin: 'They say you are a very clever [Root.GetManWoman]...but have you thought of a way to save yourself?' [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] says nothing, and thus [Root.GetHerHis] fate is sealed.
Not clever enough, it seems

The bruised and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. As [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] walks up to [Root.GetHerHim], [From.GetSheHe] realizes a certain amount of the jeers are directed at [From.GetHerHim]. Perhaps slaying a drooling moron isn't the most dignified way to honour Allah, or impress the people. Even so, it must be done.
[Root.GetSheHeCap] barely understood what was happening...

The dazed and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. As [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] watches, the court imam makes a declaration: 'This sinner has grievously offended Allah, and persisted in their error even when confronted with the truth. For such a sinner, there is nothing but death.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not

The dazed and blindfolded [Root.GetTitledName] is dragged from the dungeons into [From.Capital.GetName]'s central square, before a screaming crowd. [From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] is not even present to witness the execution, but [From.GetHerHis] court imam makes a declaration: 'This sinner has grievously offended Allah, and persisted in their error even when confronted with the truth. For such a sinner, there is nothing but death.' With those words, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s fate is sealed.
Allah may show you mercy, but I shall not
A terrible way to die!
Alas, poor [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]!
Such is as Allah commands
To prove you are free from the sin of gluttony, you have decided you shall publicly fast for ten days in repentance, while praying for the intercession of Allah.
Hunger is a demon to be defeated
It is done. Your fast is over, and while it has left you weak, you have demonstrated your piety and a new appreciation for temperance.
Everything in moderation
Charity is one of the most important virtues of Islam. To prove your charitable nature, you go among the poor and distribute a great deal of your wealth, and then pray with the lowest of the low.
Wealth is a curse

It is the responsibility of every Kharijite to spread the faith with determination and ardor. To prove your dedication, you will spend your days memorizing the Holy Qur'an until you can repeat it for the imams, no matter how stressful it might be.
It was difficult, but I did it

A Kharijite must strictly obey Sharia law as written in the Holy Qur'an, and not deviate from it. To prove your dedication, you place the decisions of your court in the hands of the Grand Muffi, and listen intently as his pronouncements are made.
It was a burden, anyway

Every Muslim must put his full faith in the Holy Qur'an, and never doubt or question it. Thus you redouble your efforts to publicly prove your faith, attending services at the mosques with renewed ardor.
But do I truly believe the words I speak?
I will repeat the words, but I do not truly believe them

Your addiction to drink is a curse, and to overcome it your redouble your efforts in every other facet of your life until you think of it no more. You publicly debase yourself before Allah and commit public penance, to prove that you are no longer the [Root.GetManWoman] they believe you to be.
Forgive me!

Your immoral lifestyle flies in the face of the Prophet's commandments, and so you eschew all personal desires and instead rededicate yourself to every other facet of your life. You publicly debase yourself before Allah and commit public penance, to prove that you are no longer the [Root.GetManWoman] they believe you to be.

Decadence is the bane of a Muslim's existence, and you have allowed yourself to wallow in your personal worth for too long. Now you rededicate yourself to every other facet of your life, publicly debasing yourself before Allah and committing public penance, to prove you are no longer the [Root.GetManWoman] they believe you to be.

Though once considered kafir, an apostate in the eyes of Allah due to [Root.GetHerHis] sinful nature, [Root.GetBestName] has committed public penance and divested [Root.GetHerselfHimself] of all immoral desires. Thus [Root.GetSheHe] is ready to be accepted back into the fold as a true Kharijite, deemed worthy by the imams.
Praise Allah!
Well done!
Your latest collection of Islamic poetry has made quite the stir at court, and your courtiers can't stop talking about them. Your fame as a poet is spreading rapidly.

The work on your epic poetry has, unfortunately, come to an end. You no longer have the mental capacity to pursue it, and the body of work you have created up to this point will, undoubtedly, have to serve as your lasting legacy.
Sadly, the work on your epic poem has come to an end now that you are imprisoned. You're not even certain you'll be able to pick up where you were once you get out...if you do.
The work on your epic poem is unfortunately delayed due to the outbreak of the war. All is not lost, however! You will pick up the quill once more once all this war business is done.

You haven't been keeping up on your prayers to expel the daemon of Sloth, which, beyond the irony of the situation, has been troubling you...
I will make a determined effort
The prayers can wait until tomorrow
A particularly irritating courtier has been on your nerves of late, when you happened to spot him prancing around with the most ridiculous hat on, causing your blood to boil.
Slowly count to ten...
Have that hat nailed to his head

Your attempts to pray your envy away have been difficult. Lately, you have begun coveting a fine horse possessed by one of your courtiers, one who has been the pride of all [Root.Capital.GetName]. It would be so simple a matter for you to just take it for yourself. What could he do?
I can do without another horse
It is rightfully mine, anyhow
Your prayers to end your pride have not been successful. However, a young member of your church has proven himself skilled at exorcisms. Do you own up and ask for his assistance?
Humbly ask him for help
No, that's ridiculous! What could he do?

A criminal is brought before you for justice, having been caught stealing a small breakfast roll from the market. Although you have been trying to end your cruel inclinations, letting this man go will reflect poorly on you...you do have a reputation to uphold, after all.
Let him go free
Hang him as he deserves!
Choose a patron saint to watch over you and to who you will direct your prayers.
St. Nestorius, the Evangelist
St. Addai, disciple and healer
Lucifer, the greatest of the Archangels
St. Adelphius, the founder of the Faith

In a dark cellar, at the stroke of midnight, you take the oath. Surrounded by pentagrams, ram skulls and strange inscriptions written in no modern tongue, you swear to keep and preserve the secrets of Cult, and to die before revealing any of them. There, you learn the secret Truths of Heaven and Hell, passed down from Adelphius himself...
Better to reign in Hell...
The Army of Lucifer

The growing power of the Messalians can no longer be denied. With the aid of [Root.GetTitledName], a group of fanatics, peasants, and madmen have now banded together to create their own army -- one that has, much to the shock of Christians elsewhere in the world, taken as its patron saint none other than Lucifer the Lightbringer, greatest of the Archangels and the King of Hell. Lucifer, they believe, is no more than an agent of chaos and change, and in His name they intend to bring about a change in the world. They will drive the demons of sin from the ranks of humanity with the force of their arms...if they are given the chance, that is.
A glorious day!

My [Root.GetLordLady], this extremely generous donation will not be forgotten. You have my friendship, as well as that of all the [From.Religion.GetName] faithful. Rest assured that you will be rewarded in the afterlife, if not on Earth!
Yours in faith,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady], this antagonism is completely unwarranted! The [holy_order_name.GetName] serves [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName], but, one has to wonder, do you?

With anger and sadness,

[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a monastery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have thought long and hard about this, and I believe I have come to the conclusion that I must dedicate my life utterly to the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. With your permission, I wish to join a nunnery, though of course I will be available at court, should you need me.

With respect,
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]
The Order of Saint Blaise

In order the stem the tide of infidels and heretics bearing down upon the innocent faithful, a small army of Armenian soldiers and clerics have banded together under the banner of Saint Blaise. With the Latins and Greeks pushing from the west and the Muslims from the East, there is very little these men have aside from unshakeable faith in the power of God to stand between them and their enemies.
Knights of true Christendom!
The Knights of Saint Mark

In order the protect the oppressed faithful from the iron scepter of Muslim domination and the encroachment of the schismatics, the Knights of Saint Mark has arisen to preserve the Coptic populations scattered throughout Egypt and Abyssinia. Tales abound of their courage and tenacity, even against innumerably greater odds.
The Church of Lollardy

The growing power of Lollardy has led it to organize itself as a reflection of the Catholic Church. Created through the political will of [From.GetBestName], this new Church has a leader: [new_lollard_primate.GetTitledName], elected at a special gathering of bishops in [From.Capital.GetName]. The Lollard world rejoices at the news!
Is this their idea of a Pope?
And so the Christian world devours itself
Glory to God!
The Waldensian Church

[Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of Waldensian Primate, head of all Christians who follow the teachings of Pierre Valdes and reject the greed and decadence of the Catholic Church. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified scholar, but to the Waldensian faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against ignorance and attempts by their fellow Christians to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will lead the Waldensians to claiming a piece of history in Europe.
A glorious day for us all!
Who is this upstart scholar?
A scholar Pope? Now I've seen everything
The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] Conclave

The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faith is considered heretical, but it would be foolish to ignore their growing power. A prominent [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] ruler by the name of [sponsor.GetTitledName] has called for a conclave in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] where [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] can meet and discuss whether a peaceful resolution of their differences is possible.
We are hoping for the best
Peace with the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] heretics? Truly?
Agree to peaceful resolution
Refuse and call conclave

In an unprecedented show of tolerance and diplomacy, [parent_relhead.GetTitledName] has agreed to a truce with [heretic_relhead.GetTitledName] and indeed the entire [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faith after a historic meeting in [sponsor.Capital.GetName]. The [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s will now be considered an offshoot of the [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] religion, their differences a permanent schism, rather than a heresy which must be suppressed and stamped out. [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] faithful across all of Europe have risen up in celebration of this momentous day.
[Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] is with us!
We must tolerated these [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s now?
A sign of [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] weakness, clearly
This is all [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetGroupName] nonsense

A historic meeting in [sponsor.Capital.GetName] between [heretic_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] and [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has ended in disaster. It was clear from the outset that [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] was ready to compromise on none of the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName] points of discussion, and eventually [parent_relhead.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] left the conclave in disgust. [parent_relhead.GetSheHeCap] shortly afterwards called for a holy war against the [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s by all [parent_relhead.Religion.GetName] faithful to reclaim their souls for [parent_relhead.Religion.GetHighGodName].
Did we truly expect any other result?
So be it!

My [Root.GetLordLady],
I have called on all [From.Religion.GetName] faithful to rise up in arms against the wicked [heretic_relhead.Religion.GetName]s and strike down their most prominent leader: [sponsor.GetBestName]. I ask that you join the cause at once, and prove the [From.Religion.GetName] faith is the only true one.

In [From.Religion.GetHighGodName]'s name,
[From.GetBestName]
To arms!
I shall consider it
Acheiropoieta

Above the gate to a city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName], there is enshrined an Acheiropoieta: an icon which, it is claimed, was not created by human hands but rather came into existence miraculously. All icons in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are condemned to be destroyed, but the people of [acheiropoieta_province.GetName] have refused to destroy the Acheiropoieta, claiming its divine heritage shelters the city from danger. [iconoclast_patriarch.GetTitledName] has, however, demanded you deal it regardless.
Send soldiers to destroy it immediately
Let them have their false icon
Take it and keep it for yourself

You still have the acheiropoieta you took so long ago from the city in [acheiropoieta_province.GetName]. You keep it in a secluded shrine that only you have access to. Lately, as you go to visit it, you hear voices in your head, telling you things, things confusing your mind...
It really is divine! Icons are real!
It is [Root.Religion.GetRandomEvilGodName] trying to destroy me!
Constantine's Return

The war is not going well, and many parts of the empire are already in chaos. Now, a group of soldiers has reportedly broken into the imperial mausoleum in the Church of the Holy Apostles, opened the sarcophagus of Constantine V, and implored him to return and save the empire. Iconoclast zealots have been quick to jump on this news, claiming it is Orthodox idolatry that is dooming the emperor. They have pleaded with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] to honor the memory of the former emperor and lead the emperor away from its idolatrous ways before it is too late.
They are right -- the idolatry must end!
That is not why we are losing the war
This does not bode well...
[From.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has embraced the iconoclast heresy, demanding that all holy icons be destroyed and all subjects of the empire convert as [From.GetSheHe] has.
Perhaps [From.GetSheHe] is right...
[From.GetSheHeCap] is a fool and a heretic!
Finally an [From.PrimaryTitle.GetTitledName] with sense!
This is of no concern to me
[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]

While the Paulician faith has been riven by internal conflicts for the last few decades, the heresy has a new leader in [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], a zealous priest of [Root.Culture.GetName] origin as well as an effective converter. He has spread his sect throughout Armenian lands ruled by the Byzantine Empire, and is very quickly becoming a major problem for Orthodox rulers.
Blasted heretics!

All across the Byzantine Empire, Paulicians are being violently persecuted on the order of [Root.GetTitledName]. They are rounded up and imprisoned, their homes burned and their belongings seized. All Paulician courtiers have been ordered either executed or banished.
Hopefully that will take care of it
A rather extreme measure...
This is an outrage!
The Paulician Patriarch

[Root.GetTitledName] has claimed the title of Paulician Patriarch, head of all Christians who follow the teachings of Paul of Samosata. Others outside of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] claim the [Root.GetManWoman] is little more than a glorified warlord, but to the Paulician faithful [Root.GetSheHe] is a symbol of their victory against attempts by their fellow Christians to suppress them. Perhaps, in time, [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will lead the Paulicians to claiming a piece of history in Europe.
A glorious day for us all!
Who is this upstart heretic?
A self-titled warmonger? How very Christian...
Bogomilists in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]

A heresiarch by the name of 'Bogomil', which may not even be his true name, has appeared in the province of Kossovo, capitalizing on the anger of the locals following their conversion from pagan ways. His teachings of a heresy that seems to combine Christianity with a combination of Gnostic dualism and anti-church sentiment has caught on extremely quickly in both Kossovo and the surrounding areas, presenting a challenge to [Root.GetTitledName]'s rule as well as to the authority of the [Root.Religion.GetName] faith. Some believe that this 'Bogomil' has reached the court of [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal], and that [Root.GetSheHe] might even be considered a conversion to these heretical beliefs.
I believe this priest has wise things to say
Me, convert? To a foul heresy?!
Hurrah!
This does not bode well...

The formalization process of Bogomilism has officially begun, with [Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] meeting with a group of perfecti leaders in [Root.Capital.GetName] and expressing [Root.GetHerHis] desire to see the faith go from a disorganized movement to one fully integrated with [Root.GetHerHis] rule. They expressed doubt, but were willing to hear [Root.GetHerHim] out, for the time being.
We will all have to be patient

All this talk of 'reforming' the Bogomilist faith in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] is pointless. Perhaps the previous rulers were interested in such a thing, but since you are not a Bogomilist, you will certainly have no part in it.
While you would gladly continue the process of reforming the Bogomilist faith, you no longer have the influence to do so.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after a recent meeting of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName]. They finally agreed to a common liturgy, so that ceremonies performed across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] use a common set of prayers and rituals, and that this will be taught to new Perfecti going forward.

Up until now, Bogomilist priests have all used different letters and gospels in their preaching, a result of the scattered and disparate beginnings of the faith. At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], the '[Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] Bible' has been written and agred upon as canon by a council of Perfecti in [Root.Capital.GetName].

In order to continue the process of formalizing the Bogomilist faith, the scattered preachers and Perfecti will need to be gathered together in councils. They resist such efforts an organization, however, and the only way to see it done will be with coin -- for the poor, for shrines, for bribes, and for God.
If that is what it takes, so be it
I will not bribe my faith into reform

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded after an unprecedented agreement from Bogomilist leaders across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] to gather in permanent councils sponsored by the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle].
A good day for all Bogomilists

A Bogomilist Perfecti has approached you with an idea for continuing your efforts to formalize your faith: the construction of several seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], each teaching a common and unified version of Bogomilism dogma to future preachers. It would be expensive, but the Perfecti says it would be a worthy achievement.
An excellent idea
Not right now

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have advanced, with the construction of numerous seminary schools across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] that would each train new priests in a standardized form of dogma.

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have been rewarded today after a prominent Perfecti in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] issued a proclamation of support. The [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] is a [Root.GetManWoman] of piety and faith, he says, and thus [Root.GetHerHis] desires should be heeded.

[Root.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal]'s tireless efforts to promote the transition of the Bogomilist faith from a disorganized movement into a structured religion have advanced after the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] gave a speech in [Root.Capital.GetName] that has been widely-disseminated and complimented by pious scholars.

A recent treatise written by [Root.GetTitledName] [Root.GetHerHim]self on the vital importance of Bogomilism's continued reforms has spread far and wide across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], and received a lot of recognition from the faithful as being full of wisdom. Indeed, some are viewing the text as a new addition to Bogomilist canon.

Recently, a new sect of Bogomilist has been spreading in [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName], one that advocates a radically different version of the faith. Normally this would not be an issue, as the sect is not popular, but it has proven disruptive to your efforts to formalize Bogomilism, as their presence has prompted other sects to follow suit.
Leave them be
Quietly get rid of them

A recent revival of Bogomilist traditionalism has taken hold in [PrimaryTitle.GetName], with numerous preachers cropping up who actively deride your efforts to reform the faith as being exactly the same sort of tyrannical structure they rebelled against in the first place. Needless to say, this has not been helpful.

A prominent Perfecti in [demand_province.GetName] has publicly begged that you slow down, if not outright stop, the process of Bogomilist reform. The common folk are confused by these contradictions, he says, and continuing down this path too quickly will only bring down God's wrath. The Perfecti is too popular to be silenced, as doing so would turn him into a martyr for his cause.
Do as he asks, for now
Ignore him

A set of crop failures and other disasters that has fallen one of your provinces in recent months has stirred the ire of several fiery preaches in the area. They say that you are to blame, that your desire for reforms and general lack of piety is what has brought down God's wrath upon the people of [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Sadly, their words have taken hold amongst many.

A prominent Perfecti has recently taken issue with your desire to reform the Bogomilist faith, pointing out a number of flaws in your argument without ever actually saying outright that your intention is solely to grab power and force the faithful into compliance. To her, you are not a learned enough [Root.GetManWoman] to push such things forward, and there is no convincing her otherwise.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s recent victory against [From.GetTitledName] in [Root.Location.GetName] has been hailed as a major victory for Bogomilism, and has spread the notion that perhaps the continuing reforms of the faith have God's favor after all.

[Root.GetTitledName]'s recent staggering loss against [From.GetTitledName] in [Root.Location.GetName] has been hailed as a sign that the ongoing reforms of the Bogomilist faith do not have God's favor after all.
Bogomilist Faith Organized

In its inception, the Bogomilist faith was only loosely organized. It didn't believe in formal churches, and opposed any kind of formal hierarchy -- this has all changed with the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName], whose piety and status as a Perfecti has encouraged all members of [Root.GetHerHis] faith to reconsider their resistance to feudal structures. Bogomilists across the world are now more formally organized, though many still do not consider them a true religion, and they remain opposed to any kind of formal church that emulates the Orthodox priesthood. Even so, there are many that object to even these changes, saying that Bogomilism has betrayed its own roots at a powerful [Root.GetLordLady]'s behest.
A better day for us all
Bogomilist Faith Formalized

Though the faithful were hardly ready for it, Bogomilism has now been formalized as a structured religion thanks to the leadership of [Root.GetTitledName]. While many see [Root.GetHerHis] leadership and piety as being worthwhile to follow, there are many who claim [Root.GetSheHe] has dragged the faith too fast into something which too much resembles the very kind of tyrannical structures they once abandoned. Preachers throughout [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] are questioning how far this will go, and whether the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetRulerTitle] has not perhaps betrayed Bogomilism's principles for the sake of power. Whatever the case, Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang.
This is how it must be
Are we truly ready for this?

After a long and arduous process of reform, the Bogomilist faith can now truly be considered a formal religion. Under the considered leadership and piety of [Root.GetTitledName], Bogomilist priests are now unified under a common liturgy, a single sacred text, and operate out of temples -- far more than the disparate heretics from where they sprang. While some question whether these reforms betray the principles upon which Bogomilism was founded, far more say they were agreed to by all and with due consideration. The faith is now ready to come into its own.
The Bogomilist Patriarchy

At the behest of [Root.GetTitledName], [new_bogomilist_patriarch.GetTitledName] has been elected as the head of the newly-founded Bogomilist Church, Bogomilism having completely transformed itself from an Orthodox heresy into a fully-formed religion in its own right. Christian leaders elsewhere have been forced to recognize this new faith as a force in its own right, and its inception as a schism from standard Christianity rather than a true heresy.
It appears we must accept this now
Heretics or not, they are still Christians

Construction has begun in Tyrnovo on the planned Church of St. Bogomil, a structure to rival St. Peter's Basilica or the Hagia Sophia. It will surely be a marvel of construction, and a bastion of faith for all Bogomilists across the world!
Let us hope I live to see it finished
The Church of St. Bogomil

As evidence of just how far the Bogomilist faith has come, the Church of St. Bogomil has completed construction in the city of Tyrnovo. A majestic structure to rival even the most potent Christian cathedrals, the church has become a bastion of faith for all Bogomilists across [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] and beyond.
St. Bogomil himself would be pleased

Word of [new_martyr.GetFirstName]'s horrid death at the hands of the [martyr_killer.Religion.GetName], [martyr_killer.GetTitledName], has spread...and now you hear that [new_martyr.GetSheHe] has been declared a [new_martyr.Religion.GetName] martyr. [new_martyr.GetSheHeCap] died for [new_martyr.GetHerHis] faith, and so history shall record [new_martyr.GetHerHis] name and remember.
Our family is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice
The [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice
The [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] is honored by [new_martyr.GetHerHis] sacrifice

An envoy from [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has informed all members of the [new_saint.GetOnlyDynastyName] dynasty that the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstName] is to be formally declared a saint during a special ceremony in three months time. You have been invited to attend this solemn occasion.

Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick]

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] strengthening of the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faith and contributions to peace and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] tireless efforts to spread the [new_saint.Religion.GetName] faith amongst the heathens and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].

In an elaborate ceremony conducted by [religion_head_title.Holder.GetTitledName], the late [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] has been formally recognized for [new_saint.GetHerHis] piety and the example [new_saint.GetSheHe] set as a true knight of Christendom, and thus has been declared a [new_saint.Religion.GetName] saint. The faithful line the streets, listening to the hymns sung in the cathedral, and rejoice when the declaration is finally made: the [new_saint.GetManWoman] once known as [new_saint.GetTitledFirstNameNoRegnal] will now and forever more be known as Saint [new_saint.GetFirstNameWithNick].
